tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.

tn.ref: Who may live on your holy hill?
tn.text: "Holy hill" here represents God's temple, which was on Mount Zion. AT: "Who may live in your holy place?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to the righteous person in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:015:001|15:02]].

tn.ref: He does not slander with his tongue
tn.text: Here "tongue" represents evil speech. AT: "He does not say evil things about innocent people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The worthless person is despised in his eyes, but he honors those who fear Yahweh
tn.text: "Righteous people hate those who have rejected God, but they honor those who respect God"
"The wicked person" or "The person who has rejected Yahweh"

Here "to be shaken" represents not living safely any longer. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "will live in safety" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
